definition: empennage (of an aircraft)/fletching (of an arrow)/fins (of a missile, rocket etc)/rear spoiler (of a car)
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc
tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌

sentences.english: Add a propeller and a tail fin and it looks exactly like a little plane.
sentences.chinese: 裝上螺旋槳和尾翼之後，看起來極像小飛機。

sentences.english: Use of the rudder and horizontal stabilizer to increase stability.
sentences.chinese: 利用方向舵和水平尾翼來增加穩定性。

sentences.english: Manufacturers built vehicles with ornamental tailfins.
sentences.chinese: 製造商生產的汽車帶有裝飾性尾翼。

sentences.english: The horizontal tail sections are made up of the elevator and the stabilizer.
sentences.chinese: 水平尾翼部分是由電梯和穩定劑。

sentences.english: The moveable horizontal surface of the empennage used for pitch trim.
sentences.chinese: 飛機尾翼的可動水平面，用來控制俯仰配平。

sentences.english: This might mean that the V-tails could be locked out in normal cruising flight.
sentences.chinese: 這或許意味着V型尾翼在超音速巡航時會被鎖定。

sentences.english: I have often seen pilots fitting the tailplane on before the wings.
sentences.chinese: 我經常看見飛行員在機翼前面配上尾翼。

sentences.english: According to news reports, they have also recovered a large tail section of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 根據最新報導，他們同時也找到了飛機的一大塊尾翼。

sentences.english: You can see the stabilators moving around a little to maintain stable flight.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到水平尾翼在調整以保持穩定的飛行。

sentences.english: Aircraft tail broken fuselage wreckage caught fire, smoke billowing.
sentences.chinese: 飛機尾翼折斷，機身殘骸起火，濃煙滾滾。

definition: the front (nose) of a plane etc
